word: I inquired how many children she had. She replied, "Eleven." Then pointing to two pretty, bright-looking little girls, said, "These are my youngest--one is six and the other four. My eldest are grown-up boys." She said that they as a family were on their way from Iowa City to Nebraska, where there is plenty of land and work for their children. They intended to locate there. Not a bad idea to give these high-toned, sharp, active boys employment; there is nothing so beneficial as plenty to do to keep children from being ruined with the temptations and allurements of evil.
